title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:48 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: now  
00:48 <+sburjan`> but not for long  
00:49 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: Nevermind  
00:50 <@sdumitriu> Will talk tomorrow, if you're available  
00:50 <@sdumitriu> Will you be?  
00:50 <+sburjan`> yes, until 16:30 ro time  
00:50 <+sburjan`> I've tested all day. found onyl 3 minor bugs  
00:52 <+sburjan`> so don'te xpect a ton of bugs for the release (which is good)  
00:58 <Denis> has quit  
01:30 <Spazholio> has quit  
01:57 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
02:06 <Spazholio> has joined #xwiki  
02:17 <DrLou> has quit  
02:31 <abusenius> has quit  
02:31 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
03:13 <abusenius> has quit  
03:39 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
06:07 <DrLou> has quit  
08:17 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <vmassol> restarting myxwiki  
08:33 <@sdumitriu> Good morning  
08:33 <vmassol> ah no space left on device  
08:35 <vmassol> sdumitriu: good morning  
08:36 <vmassol> trying to figure out what I could remove and what has been taking up space  
08:36 <vmassol> any idea?  
08:36 <@sdumitriu> Let me check  
08:36 <vmassol> I'll start by remvoing some old xwiki install backup  
08:37 <@sdumitriu> Hm, Available space: 628G  
08:37 <@sdumitriu> On node2  
08:37 <vmassol> yes I'm talking about node1  
08:39 <vmassol> should we do a find to list files added within say 1 to 2 weeks?  
08:39 <@sdumitriu> Logs  
08:39 <vmassol> they don't take up that much space  
08:39 <vmassol> I've removed all xwiki.log\*  
08:39 <@sdumitriu> catalina.out does  
08:40 <vmassol> we only have 2011 logs right now  
08:40 <@cjdelisle> check for attachments in the temp dir  
08:40 <vmassol> catalina.out is 0 byte  
08:40 <vmassol> hmm i don't get it  
08:40 <vmassol> I've removed 4 backups of xwiki installs  
08:40 <vmassol> and still 100% used  
08:41 <@cjdelisle> I think that's it. The attachments in the temp dir are supposed to be deleted when the jvm stops but if it stops because of a SIGKILL signal, it's not going to delete them  
08:41 <vmassol> that should have freed at least 500MB  
08:41 <vmassol> something is eating memory right now?  
08:42 <vmassol> the DB also grows btw  
08:44 <vmassol> just dmeeted a 4GB file  
08:44 <vmassol> and still 0 bytes available.. wtf?  
08:44 <@cjdelisle> different partition?  
08:45 <vmassol> there's only 2  
08:45 <@sdumitriu> The space is being taken by another VM  
08:45 <@sdumitriu> One that does backups  
08:45 <vmassol> one for tmp  
08:45 <vmassol> and one for hd1  
08:45 <@sdumitriu> Since the disk is the same for all VMs  
08:45 <vmassol> sure but deleting 4GB shoul dhave an effect  
08:45 <vmassol> even if the disk is shared  
08:46 <vmassol> removing tomcat temp files now  
08:47 <@sdumitriu> Me too  
08:47 <vmassol> should I stop my command?  
08:48 <vmassol> ok done  
08:49 <@sdumitriu> Indeed, whatever we delete, there's still 0 bytes available  
08:51 <@sdumitriu> Still, as root, I can create new files  
08:51 <@sdumitriu> I think the 0 bytes free space is a lie  
08:51 <@sdumitriu> Debian lies!  
08:52 <vmassol> restarting tomcat  
08:52 <@cjdelisle> df -h?  
08:52 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
08:53 <vmassol> sdumitriu: still /usr/local/tomcat/bin/catalina.sh: line 326: echo: write error: No space left on device  
08:53 <vmassol> (when starting tomcat)  
08:54 <@sdumitriu> Yes, only root can use that free space  
08:54 <@sdumitriu> That's a feature  
08:54 <@sdumitriu> There is some free space which is reserved for root  
08:54 <vmassol> ok  
08:55 <vmassol> still it means it's not lying and there's no space avail  
08:55 <vmassol> something is eating all space avail  
08:55 <vmassol> guys sorry but I have to leave you… I'm still on holidays this morning and got to go… I'll be back just after lunch  
08:56 <vmassol> (I'll let you fix this)  
09:43 <xulingzhi> has joined #xwiki

13:38 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: around ?  
13:49 <vmassol> hi guys  
13:49 <vmassol> is the myxwiki issue fixed?  
13:51 <+sburjan> hi vmassol  
13:57 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: MTR for 3.1 M2 is ready. No blockers found. Please ping me during the weekend so I can test packages (if they will be ready by then)
